Game_of_Life

Class GUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game_of_Life.GUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class GUI
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Class with the Graphical and logical part of the program (main code) Using object from the classes 'Cell' and 'Board' and new variables, methods and functions, this class provides the main code of the project.
    Author:
    David Mendez Merino

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GUI()
      Default constructor for GUI (no parameters) Initialise the frame and some of the variable values.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Clean_board()
      Method to clean the board.
      void Draw_Example_1()
      Method to 'draw' the distribution of the example 1 in the board It goes through the board using a double for loop and setting alive the required cells

      Method to 'draw' the distribution of the example 2 in the board It goes through the board using a double for loop and setting alive the required cells

    • Constructor Detail

      • GUI

        public GUI()
        Default constructor for GUI (no parameters) Initialise the frame and some of the variable values.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Launch the application. It creates a GUI object, initialise the board and set the frame to 'visible'

      • Restart_board

        public void Restart_board()
        Method to set the initial configuration of the game when it is restarted It initialise the variables, clean the board and configure the buttons.

      • Clean_board

        public void Clean_board()
        Method to clean the board. It sets the alive Cells to died Cells in order to have a clean board.

      • Draw_Initial_Board

        public static void Draw_Initial_Board()
        Method to 'draw' the initial board. It creates the board using a GridLayout panel and a double for loop to go through the panel, adding a Cell object in each position.

      • RefreshPopulation

        public static void RefreshPopulation()
        Method to update the JtextField 'Population'

      • Execute_Game

        public void Execute_Game()
        Method with the main logic of the game. It goes through the board, position by position (double for loop), checking every cell and its alive neighboring cells. Depending on how many alive neighboring cells there are, the logic will determinate if the cell is born, dies or keep alive.

      • Update_Cell_States

        public void Update_Cell_States()
        Method to update the state of the cells. 'New_State' will become the current 'state'

      • GetAliveCells

        public int GetAliveCells(int row,
                         int col,
                         int MaxRow,
                         int MaxCol)
        Function to calculate how many alive neighboring a particular cell has. Depending on the position of the cell within the board, some of the neighbors will be checked. Avoiding issues with the 'ArrayOutOfBound' exceptions.
        Parameters:
        row - int value that indicates the row of the cell within the board
        col - int value that indicates the column of the cell within the board
        MaxRow - int value that indicates how many rows the board has
        MaxCol - int value that indicates how many columns the board has
        Returns:
        The number of alive neighboring cells

      • run

        public void run()
        Thread run. It contains the code the thread will execute The thread will be running inside a while loop until the user decide to stop the execution pressing Stop_Button.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • Draw_Example_1

        public void Draw_Example_1()
        Method to 'draw' the distribution of the example 1 in the board It goes through the board using a double for loop and setting alive the required cells

      • Draw_Example_2

        public void Draw_Example_2()
        Method to 'draw' the distribution of the example 2 in the board It goes through the board using a double for loop and setting alive the required cells

      • Draw_Example_3

        public void Draw_Example_3()
        Method to 'draw' the distribution of the example 3 in the board It goes through the board using a double for loop and setting alive the required cells
